question: "Along the River During the Qingming Festival" is the famous painting from which nation?
explanation: "Along the Rivers During the Qingming Festival" is a famous Chinese painting of the painter Zhang Zeduan. He was a painter during the Song dynasty. This particular painting portrayed the daily life of people and their celebration during the Qingming Festival in the capital city of Kaifeng of the Northern Song. It has been called "China's Mona Lisa".
